sentences.english: Next day he comes by again, and she brags that she didn't dream of him.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，他又來了，她嘲笑根本沒有夢到他。

sentences.english: He could not get a hare again; instead he was laughed at by the people of Song.
sentences.chinese: 兔子他再也得不到，他自己反倒被宋國人嘲笑了。

sentences.english: Patty minded his ridiculing less when her mother was the butt of it.
sentences.chinese: 如果她爸的嘲笑對象是她媽，帕蒂就不怎麼介意了。

sentences.english: We shared glances in class and laughed at each other's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 我們在教室相互凝視着，各自嘲笑對方所講的笑話。

sentences.english: When SSH jokes, he will turn hellos head and look for KTHsreaction.
sentences.chinese: 宋承憲講嘲笑話的時候回頭不雅察泰熙反映。

sentences.english: I have friends who, I suspect, secretly scoff at my mild work-out routines.
sentences.chinese: 我疑心有幾個朋友偷偷嘲笑我溫和的鍛鍊程序。

sentences.english: She spoon-fed her son until he was age six and people began to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 她用湯匙喂兒子喂到他六歲，人們開始嘲笑她。

sentences.english: Have you ever laughed at those people with disabilities?
sentences.chinese: 你曾經嘲笑過那些殘廢人嗎？

sentences.english: The taunts of her schoolmates caused her intense mental suffering.
sentences.chinese: 她同學的嘲笑給她帶來強烈的精神痛苦。

sentences.english: An off-duty police officer is caught on camera at a bar, mocking a man he watched die.
sentences.chinese: 這名警察在酒吧嘲笑一名他正在調查的案件中的死者。

sentences.english: Once a league laughingstock, nobody even so much as smirks at the Hornets anymore.
sentences.chinese: 曾經聯盟的笑柄，沒人再去嘲笑蜜蜂了。

sentences.english: The crowd hooted and jeered at the speaker.
sentences.chinese: 羣衆向那演講人發出輕蔑的叫囂和嘲笑。

sentences.english: We should not laugh at those who make mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我們不應該嘲笑犯錯誤的人。

sentences.english: Do not jeer at the mistakes or misfortunes of others.
sentences.chinese: 不要嘲笑別人的錯誤或不幸。

sentences.english: We all derided her for her ignorance.

definition: to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
